Azaleas

A native Chinese plant of the rhododendron family, it requires careful watering and does not tolerate lime water. Perhaps that is why it survives so little and is one of the biggest challenges for plant lovers. It is a slow-growing plant, usually flowers from April to May, likes cool temperatures and needs watering every other day in hot weather. It also needs to be transplanted outdoors every year.
Begonias

Begonias are popular plants because of their beauty and diversity of colours and shapes. They should be cared for in semi-shade, with a draining substrate and moderate watering. The cultivation of begonias is not very difficult. There are more than 2,000 species and under them, numerous varieties. They flower at the beginning of summer and finish their cycle with the first frosts of autumn.
Christmas Cactus

It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is a plant native to Central and South America. Although it looks different from most cacti, what differentiates it the most are its flowers, which are shaped like feathers, hence its common name of Santa Teresa\'s feathers, and it flowers earlier than most other species. The flowers can be pink, red, white, orange or yellow and measure between 3 and 5 cm in diameter. It is one of the longest-lasting catus, since in a pot it has a life of between 3 and 10 years. Its cultivation is simple, although it has the disadvantage that some of its segments can be damaged for no apparent reason, so it is necessary to pay attention to its care and eliminate the parts that look bad.
Calatheas

It is a tropical plant of the marantas family, depending on the species, the plant adopts different sizes, colours and shapes in its leaves. The leaves are born rolled and then open, the stems grow in clusters, they are perennial and their leaves have an ability called nioctinasia, where the leaves open during the day to seek the sun and close at night to reduce water loss.
Crassula

It belongs to the family of thick-leaved plants (Crassulaceae). It also belongs to the subfamily Crassuloideae. This tree grows to a maximum height of approximately 3 metres. It has a thick, straight stem and many branches. At its base, it is often strongly branched. It is a well-known succulent plant everywhere and is very easy to obtain, grows easily and is fairly easy to care for.
Dionaea Muscipula

Called Diana flytrap in some countries such as South America and more commonly known as Venus flytrap, it is one of the most emblematic types of carnivorous plants. It is the only species in the genus Dionaea, which originated in North Carolina. Its leaves grow from a buried rhizome, forming a rosette with a length of between 3cm and 8cm, growing horizontally. At flowering time in spring, it gives rise to a flowering stem growing from the very centre of the plant, which is up to 20cm high and with a striking small white flower at the tip.
Echeveria

Also called alabaster rose, it is actually a whole genus of succulent plants that forms part of the Crassulaceae family. It is native to Mexico and Brazil, with about 400 species, very resistant to drought conditions and thermal variations, its stems reach heights of up to 20cm and it produces pink or yellowish flowers from winter to spring.
Euphorbia

It is commonly known as the crown of Christ plant or crown of thorns plant because there is a legend that this was the plant used to make the crown of thorns. It is originally from Madagascar, a shrub that can reach, or even exceed, heights of 1 metre and stands out for the red or pink bracts of its flowers, which are very striking. It is a very hardy succulent plant, which can flower all year round in the right climate and conditions.
Guzmania (Francesca)

It is one of the most beautiful and unusual houseplants to be found and is very popular, not only for its beauty, but also for its easy care. Its leaves, like its inflorescence, are highly decorative.
Carnations

They are native to Eurasia, and have become a symbol of many Mediterranean countries because of their beauty. They are perennial herbs that bloom during spring and summer, among which a great variety of colours and shapes can be found.
Margarite
They are one of the most popular plants in the world and their flowers are so characteristic. They are extremely prolific, and there are more than 140 different species.
Violas

Also called pansy plants, they are native to northern Europe and currently have an enormous number of varieties, with different types of flower colours and sizes. They need a very luminous area and keep the soil moist without puddling (in bloom they are watered every 2 or 3 days). It is edible, it flowers in autumn and in warm climates its flowering can extend until spring.
